item.title: Director, IA Analytics Ecosystem
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Director, IA Analytics Ecosystem

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

As Director, IA Analytic Ecosystem, you will be accountable for the development of data products and services that span across all platforms in Internal Audit. The role creates new and innovative ways to leverage data across all of RBC’s businesses for new opportunities.  The role defines, supports and informs business strategies through the breakdown, analysis and understanding of vast amounts of data, both internal and external to RBC.  Provides engagement and leadership to a development team so they can deliver big data solutions for critical applications and regulatory requirements. Interacts with senior leaders to ensure that business value is being generated from the set of enterprise data services that the director is responsible for.


The RBC CAE Group leverages a unique perspective— with a coordinated view across the entire business—to deliver valuable advice that not only gives assurance, but that illuminates a bigger picture, connects dots, builds best practices and broadens possibilities. We connect intelligence to protect and enable RBC.

What will you do?  

  • Strong Collaboration and Stakeholder management. Partner with Internal Audit Product Owners and Data Leads to understand business objectives and technology requirements in order to lead, support and recommend solutions that add business value, both current and future
  • Lead and execute Proof of Concept (POC) for new technologies and present feedback, recommendation and/or final decisions
  • Lead and evolve Audit Data Domain custodianship through automation for data catalogue, data lineage and data quality  integration with CDO data governance platform
  • Lead the upkeep and maintenance of the Ecosystem infrastructure, analytics process and ensuring technology currency
  • Develop new and evolve current analytics capabilities and standards to ensure efficiencies and effectiveness in IA data management and analytics practice.
  • Lead and actively pursue innovation and ideation. Present opportunities and proposed architecture to senior leadership and lead the build out of those opportunities.
  • Lead and actively pursue automation opportunities to drive Audit efficiencies
  • Demonstrate leadership presence: Establish credibility by demonstrating subject matter expertise and knowledge in process excellence, be confident, authentic and effective, respect diversity and coach others, connect and engage stakeholders, build rapport, build strong relationships subject matter experts

What do you need to succeed?

Must-have 

  • Undergraduate degree    (e.g. B.Com., B. Math, P. Eng., MSc (Data Science)
  • Extensive experience in a big data environment with a focus on end to end medium/large project development
  • Exceptional development expertise using Python/APIs/JS/HTML/DAO
  • Exceptional knowledge of Database technologies SQL. Hadoop and Data Engineering tools e.g. Dataiku, Data stage and Data Visualization tools e.g. Tableau
  • Strong knowledge for creation of automated unit tests, integration, end-to-end testing and DevOps practices (E.g. CI/CD).
  • Undergraduate STEM degree (e.g. B.Sc, P. Eng.)

Nice-to-have 

  • Post-Graduate coursework e.g., (MSc in Data Science)
  • Functional knowledge of Predictive Analytics and Statistical Modelling (using R and/or Python)
  • A good sense of UX/UI design and visualization for translating business user stories to working prototypes with HTML5/CSS,Plot.ly ,D3 JavaScript libraries

What’s in it for you? This is standard

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation
  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities 
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
  • Opportunities to do challenging work and make lasting through Business value generation

Job Summary

Address:

TORONTO, Ontario, Canada

City:

CAN-ON-TORONTO

Country:

Canada

37.5

Full time

Platform:

item.title: Senior Manager- Venture Analytics
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Senior Manager- Venture Analytics

Job Description

RBC Ventures is a new kind of organization – one that marries the strength of one of the world’s most trusted and successful financial institutions with a mission to reimagine the role we play in people’s lives. We are building a world class team focused on creating new experiences, exploring new business models and developing new relationships that add value to how people live and work. 

About Ventures Analytics

The Venture Analytics team solves strategic problems across the organization using a data-driven approach. We leverage data to unlock opportunities, influence strategy, assess the impact of business tactics and make relevant recommendations to the individual ventures, internal or external partners. Our team has seen massive growth since last year, and have provided tremendous value across RBC Ventures teams and RBC Lines of Business (LOB). In 2022, our priority is to expand the team to scale our services and provide opportunities for new team members to find innovative solutions.

What is the opportunity?

  • Collaborate with Ventures and/or RBC’s external partners to understand core business goals and help achieve results through a data driven approach.

  • Develop strong relationships with your stakeholders to achieve superior business results and long lasting impact.

  • Design and conduct analyses using various techniques (developing frameworks, dashboarding, segmentation, modeling) to provide value for the stakeholders you support.

  • Communicate approaches & insights effectively to influence decision making at senior leadership levels.

 

What do you need to succeed?

Business acumen, curiosity, good communication, and strong technical skills.

Must Have:

  • 5+ years of relevant experience in an analytical function (e.g. Business Analytics, Consulting).

  • 3+ years of SQL (for analyses & creating reports) with additional experience in predictive analytics (R, Python, etc.).

  • Experience with complex, large-scale relational databases, and statistical programs, with an aptitude to adapt and implement additional technical applications or tools

  • Experience managing data tools/platforms and hosting team-based knowledge sharing sessions

  • Proven track record of communicating analytics and Machine Learning results back to business partners and/or C-level.

  • Ability to inform and influence stakeholders cross-functionally through data, building relationships, while communicating early and often

  • We like to have fun and work with people who are passionate about analytics. We are looking for someone who thrives in a diverse and inclusive culture.
     

Nice to Have:

  • Experience publishing reports/dashboards, and visualizations with Tableau is a big plus.

  • Leadership experience (in direct and/or indirect reporting capacity).

  • University degree in a quantitative field of study (e.g., statistics, economics, analytics)
     

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits

  • The opportunity to learn about the business models of a variety of ventures and RBC external partners

  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities

  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact

  • Work in an agile, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team

  • The opportunity to interface with senior level executives from many different parts of the organization

VSANALYTICS

 RBCVentures

 #LI-Hybrid

item.title: Manager, Cards Analytics and Insights
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Manager, Cards Analytics and Insights

Job Description

RBC is currently recruiting for a Manager role for the Cards, Payments and Banking team. Your responsibilities will include:

  • Providing end-to-end analytics advisory services including conceptualizing business questions, designing and executing analytics framework and recommending and influencing the credit card business for decision making purpose
  • Identifying underlying business trends using analytical tools and transforming them into actionable insights

What will you do?

  • Act as a subject matter expert regarding analytics / data science topics (e.g. data visualization, storytelling, KPI definition, statistical analysis, predictive modelling etc.).
  • Support business growth targets by understanding business needs and providing concise, insightful and timely analytics of key trends through interpretation of interplays between portfolio / business performance, costs and business strategy.
  • Assist Senior Manager and collaborate with business partners in rapid identification, prioritization and deployment of analytics to define new potential business opportunities and to support decisions through the provision of industry and competitor data.
  • Participate in cross-functional teams through the analytics process to make sound information-based decisions and develop robust measures to effectively identify, mitigate and monitor risks and opportunities.
  • Present and defend analysis and recommendations to a wide range of stakeholders and senior key decision makers.

What do you need to succeed?

Must-have     

  • At least two previous work term experiences in clients, product, marketing or risk analytical or reporting role; Experiences in supporting credit card business and/or financial services industry an asset
  • Programming experience to extract data and complete complex analytics. SAS / SQL required. R, Python, etc. preferred
  • Instinctive curiosity and strategic mindset to drill into the analytics to understand business drivers and predict business growth and the technical ability to apply this knowledge to resolve complex business questions
  • Proven ability to communicate clearly and concisely to all levels of the company. Strong skills in presentation and story telling
  • A hunger for continued development and learning

Nice-to-have

  • Knowledge in Hadoop, Google Analytics and Big Data environment
  • Advance degree in quantitative discipline

item.title: Senior Associate - Data Analytics
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Senior Associate - Data Analytics

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

You will work closely with business and technology teams across Wealth Management International (WMI) to support the delivery of analytical insights, develop and curate data assets, build dashboards and model data that will enable data driven decisions.

What will you do?

  • Develop, enhance and maintain the evolving Data Analytics data infrastructure in line with the business needs to support the overarching data strategy across the organization
  • Identify, source, stage and model data using industry standard technologies and established development and operational practices as part of the end-to-end data lifecycle
  • Work with the business to identify and source data points across core platforms and processes for inclusion within the Data Analytics data repository
  • Ability to structure large disparate data sets to serve multiple functions and tailor the results for specific audiences, creating models to support investigation and analysis
  • Ability to create new and modify existing T-SQL scripts, stored procedures and SSIS packages to support new and regular reporting requirements
  • Research, explore and understand business problems and reporting requirements to facilitate the design, development and deployment of solutions and dashboards, enabling end-user self-service, incorporating drill-down functionality
  • Provide data driven and thought provoking insights to drive informed decision-making, transferring knowledge to stakeholders and enabling the business to use its data more effectively
  • Through the delivery of informative reporting solutions; support, inspire and educate end-users to use data more effectively to improve overarching data literacy across the organization
  • Analyse, document and recommend improvements to existing business practices to capitalise on opportunities for automation, efficiencies and risk reduction to enhance capabilities and streamline end-to-end data related processes
  • Responsible for the design, development and ongoing maintenance of the scalable Data Analytics data infrastructure using the Microsoft SQL technology stack to serve as the foundational layer for analytics and insights, support and guide team on technical design and implementations

What do you need to succeed?

Must-have

  • Proven experience with MS SQL Server
  • Sound understanding of relational database principals, guidelines and design
  • Extensive SQL query development experience
  • Familiarity and experience with data visualisation tools
  • Data management specialist with ability to mine data and predictive modelling
  • Advanced knowledge of, and experience in manipulating large disparate data sets from multiple sources in multiple formats

Nice-to-have

  • Knowledge of Tableau
  • Experience with JIRA
  • Experience with GitHub
  • Knowledge of Agile project management principles
  • Knowledge of R and Python

What is in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best - progressive thinking to keep growing and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper.  We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
  • Opportunities to work with the best in the field
  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
  • Flexible working options fully supported

item.title: Trade Surveillance & Data Analytics Manager
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Trade Surveillance & Data Analytics Manager

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

The Trade Surveillance & Data Analytics Manager provides best-in-class trade surveillance analysis and reporting to manage risks, and to ensure compliance with provincial/territorial securities legislation and internal policies and procedures for Royal Mutual Funds Inc. (RMFI) distribution channels. RMFI has over 9,500 licensed representatives conducting over 30,000 transactions per day.

The incumbent will improve the level of compliance and management of risk for the RMFI distribution channels by monitoring and reporting on trends, developing insights and by providing recommendations to improve compliance review processes.  In addition, this individual will bring digital knowledge to deliver insightful reporting and ad hoc analytics. The Trade Surveillance & Data Analytics Manager is a data driven role which takes an analytically rigorous approach to establishing actionable intelligence.

Please note that as Trade Surveillance & Data Analytics Manager, you can be based out of Toronto or Montreal.

What will you do?

  • Develop and implement new or enhanced surveillance program practices to ensure effective operational efficiencies and to evaluate controls for compliance requirements.

  • Optimize daily/monthly/quarterly report generation, distribution, follow-up and escalation

  • Support the team with training, supervisory review, trade reviews and follow up of daily/monthly/quarterly reports for suspicious activity and suitability of advice.

  • Identify trends that may impact regulatory compliance and make recommendations to mitigate or address the areas of concern, based on daily, monthly and quarterly routines.

  • Lead and manage special initiatives and other monitoring and testing to drive effectiveness and efficiency of RMFI Compliance policies and processes.

  • Follow, review and enhance procedures that clearly show “evidence of review” and follow-up that will be satisfactory to the regulators.

  • Prepare trade data for supervisory investigations, as well as internal audits and MFDA inquiries.

  • Ensure the surveillance processes and procedures are current and up-to-date, in keeping with changes to regulations applicable to RMFI.

What do you need to succeed?

Must-have

  • 3+ years’ experience in investment industry and/or compliance in the financial industry and/or experience in data analytics

  • Experience conducting data analysis and reporting results as a foundation to provide meaningful analysis to facilitate business decisions at a senior management/executive level

  • Proven problem solving, innovation and analytics skills; used to design, development and test reporting requirements

  • Sound presentation, communication (verbal and written), time management and organizational skills

  • Excellent PC skills, including solid knowledge of Microsoft Office, experience designing SQL queries or experience with MS Access and programming knowledge.

  • Innovative self-starter with strong attention to detail and the ability to work independently in an unstructured environment

Nice-to-have

  • Experience with creating dashboards in Tableau or other visualization tools as well as proficiency with Python and/or VBA

  • Strong understanding of RBC Investment and banking systems and knowledge of Mutual Fund products

  • A growth mindset, always looking to improve and streamline processes and reporting.

  • Impact, influence, maturity and skills/judgement to deal effectively with stakeholders, including collaboration with IT partners to help facilitate projects and oversight

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation

  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact

  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team

  • Opportunities to take on progressively greater responsibilities

item.title: Senior Manager, Data Quality Assurance & Analytics
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Senior Manager, Data Quality Assurance & Analytics

Job Description

  • Define testing scope and methodology using a risk-based approach against data sets/portfolios, data sources/systems, reporting elements, and data infrastructure components
  • Engage with stakeholders to gather information required in defining testing cycles and engagement model 
  • Create repeatable documented test scripts and maintain them accordingly
  • Define data testing automation requirements and engage with technology partners for tool selection and use
  • Document data testing procedures and controls including identifying the entrance and exit criteria of key processes and classifying risk and controls accordingly as well as reporting self-identified findings and remediating them
  • Execute data testing procedures and test scripts including identifying root cause of issues and grouping them into themes
  • Produce test results memo including clearly articulating test results, summarizing key findings and issues and communicate the data testing story to stakeholders
  • Engage stakeholders to solicit their remediation plans and validate that remediation plans are sustainable
  • Proactively identify opportunities to improve and optimize the data quality assurance processes including recommending analytical tools and training courses
  • Contributes content for the development of training materials
  • Conduct knowledge sharing sessions amongst staff within the Enterprise Chief Data Office and participate in key events and meetings
  • Promote the value of data quality assurance & analytics services to key stakeholders across the bank and establish strong and trusted relationships
  • Prepare and contribute materials required for regulatory and internal audit exams as required
  • Escalate operational risks and issues and control deficiencies that you identify in your line of work to your line manager on a timely basis

Job Summary

•The Senior Manager, Data Quality Assurance & Analytics is responsible for conducting the independent validation over the accuracy and integrity of data throughout the data supply chain that supports the firm’s key business processes such as regulatory reporting and critical management reporting. This entails performing data analysis and transaction testing using analytical tools to address key risks associated with the data sets and data infrastructure.

•The Senior Manager position is an individual contributor role within the Data Quality Assurance & Analytics function of the Enterprise Data Governance Operations (EDGO) of the Chief Data Office (CDO). The EDGO functions as a ‘Second Line of Defense’ within RBC’s ‘Three Lines of Defense’ model, accountable for managing the firm’s information management risk in support of RBC’s operational risk management objectives. The Senior Manager position reports to the Director of Data Quality Assurance & Analytics.

Address:

Jersey City, New Jersey, United States of America

City:

Country:

United States of America

40

item.title: Manager, HEF Data Analytics - 16 Months Contract
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Manager, HEF Data Analytics - 16 Months Contract

Job Description

Big Data Visualization & Infrastructure

  • Support the development of future-state tools and capabilities to drive value-added insights and transparency for users across the organization.
  • Enhance the existing Tableau tools to incorporate on-going user feedback, identify possible synergies with other reports across HEF/PFP, deliver further efficiency through automation of processes, and expose timely and relevant information to end-users.
  • Collaborate with partners across RBC to identify new sources of information in order to augment current data elements and provide more in depth insights into profile & behaviour of clients.
  • Maintain existing data visualization framework by ensuring accurate and timely updates, optimize the tool performance to reduce lag/down times, and maintenance of user group(s) to ensure compliance with governance and code of conduct standards.
  • Enable capability to drive reporting of data visualization tool usage and ongoing report backs to provide an assessment of user needs.
  • Proactively research, and identify, new tools and capabilities in order to maintain market leading position on optimization of analytical, lead management and reporting activity.

Portfolio Management & Reporting

  • Deliver regular updates on the Monthly Business Review (MBR) providing key business intelligence to the Home Equity Finance leadership team and supporting partners.
  • Update market share results on a monthly basis, providing a granular view into the performance of RBC against its peers, while looking to continuously improve existing capabilities.
  • Support the development, and ongoing update, to the Quarterly Competitive analysis shared with senior executives across HEF and members of the Canadian Banking Operating Committee.
  • Support data aggregation from analyst calls of major banks in Canada, and highlight key insights as it pertains to their respective Real Estate Secured Lending (RESL) portfolios. Report is aimed to help Senior Management identify key opportunities and if a change in the strategy is required to ensure HEF is able to reach its annual targets.
  • Obtain an in-depth understanding of the HEF products and segments in order to effectively provide value-added insights.
  • Create materials to communicate the insights developed either through new reporting or specific stakeholder presentations and working sessions.
  • Collaborate with partners across RBC to ensure data quality and integrity.

Advanced Analytics – including Predictive Modeling

  • Leverage data-driven tactics to provide key analytical and business insights to support the leadership group in active management of the Home Equity portfolio.
  • Provide tactical backing to stakeholders by leading/participating in deep-dive analyses required to better understand key objectives and opportunities.
  • Proactively identify areas of improvement for the HEF portfolio in order to drive the following: incremental balance growth, revenue prospects, and areas creating synergy and optimizing overall costs.
  • Work collaboratively and advise on business decisions through use of reporting, leading edge analytics, measurement of key performance indicators, and early detection of trends & anomalies.
  • Develop and maintain report-backs on success of initiatives with regular cadence to ensure effective monitoring of expected outcomes. Communicate results to key stakeholders and ensure insights are managed to optimize future activities.

  • Participate in high-priority initiatives required to support the HEF and PFP senior management teams.

Big Data Visualization & Infrastructure – 40%

Portfolio Management & Reporting – 40%

Advanced Analytics – 20%

Job Summary

The Manager, HEF Portfolio Management will play an integral role and is responsible for bringing HEF into the forefront of advanced analytics and data visualization tactics. The incumbent will primarily support the Portfolio Management team, while also working with other members of the broader HEF team to deliver on key analytical priorities. The role will leverage data-driven tactics to deliver insights that will enable better understanding of client behaviour and trends to formulate strategies for business optimization, financial performance management, product and customer profitability, key segment understanding, retention/acquisition programs, targeted marketing, competitive intelligence/research, innovation and leading edge tools and practices. Furthermore, the incumbent will maintain ongoing reporting of the HEF portfolio and competitive landscape, providing key insights to the HEF senior leadership teams and key stakeholders.

item.title: Vice President (Associate Director Equivalent), Portfolio Governance & Analytics
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Vice President (Associate Director Equivalent), Portfolio Governance & Analytics

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

The Business Transformation group is dedicated to enabling business opportunities through collaboration and delivery excellence of strategic Capital Markets initiatives. 

We are looking for an eager and high performing individual to ensure all PMs to follow the PMO standards, and use the tools to actually reduce project delivery risk across the portfolio. This position will plan and designate project resources, prepare budgets, monitor progress, and keep stakeholders informed in a timely manner on key initiatives.

What will you do?

Primary Responsibilities:

  • Improve executive insights into emerging project risks through better portfolio reporting and by establishing new governance meetings

  • Guide the project/portfolio planning, monitoring and controls function, including intake of new proposals and execution of the triage, prioritization and approval processes to move projects through the Investment Review Board and Project Approval Meetings

  • Act as a liaison between business departments and Technology by educating stakeholders about planning practices and regularly identifying areas for improvement

  • Lead the quality assurance program and routing of Project Change Requests (PCRs)

  • Position the PM CoE as a trusted partner by striving for excellence and communicating with conviction

  • Develop new processes, standards, best practices, tools and techniques using a risk-based approach in partnership with the CM PMO.

  • Maintain a strong understanding of the PMO landscape in RBC and ensure the Capital Markets COO group is represented accurately in target operating models

  • Produce program portfolio status reporting and at the Executive level to ensure goals and objectives are clearly and consistently communicated across all teams

  • Analyze project and portfolio data, develop metrics & benchmarks, and provide insightful and accurate reporting to support management decisions

  • Drive the development of dashboards to highlight trends, changes and potential risks/issues in the portfolio.

  • Develop and coach junior staff to deliver against business priorities

What do you need to succeed?

Must Have:

  • University degree or equivalent experience

  • Over 10 years experience in the following:

  • Understanding of data management practices

  • Project Management, Business Analyst methodology, Risk Management, Audit and/or Financial Services industry

  • Resource management

  • Negotiation, facilitation and presentation skills with strong experience preparing PowerPoint decks

  • Expert level communication skills both written and verbal

  • Ability to manage and coordinate across numerous stakeholders in various areas of the organization

  • Comfort with analysis and analytical processes and basic tools such as Excel, Tableau, SharePoint, Confluence, JIRA

  • Quality control

  • Cost / Benefit analysis and alternative identification

  • Conflicts and issues resolution and escalation

Nice to Have :

  • Understanding of CM business and structure

  • Previous people management experience

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities

  • Variety of assignments over the course of your placement

  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact

  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, and high-performing team

  • Opportunities to do challenging work

Job Summary

Address:

TORONTO, Ontario, Canada

City:

CAN-ON-TORONTO

Country:

Canada

Work hours/week:

37.5

Employment Type:

Full time

Platform:

Capital Markets

Job Type:

Regular

Pay Type:

Salaried

2022-08-05-07:00

Application Deadline:

2022-09-07-07:00

item.title: Business Analyst, Measurement & Performance, Client Operations
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Business Analyst, Measurement & Performance, Client Operations

Job Description

What will you do?

  • Be a local lead responsible for monthly global business reporting cycle including data collection (structured and unstructured data), data validation, report production and review
  • Use of VBA macros, SQL, Microsoft Access database, KPI Datamart (Oracle) to generate monthly client KPI, MIS and Oversight Reporting
  • Maintenance of EUC, Microsoft Access Database and SQL to update changes according to client request
  • Work closely with respective Global Client Operations business lines, ensure data and information received and obtained from business SME, business applications are complete, accurate and delivered on time
  • Meet with global client managers to discuss new client reporting requirements and change requirements
  • Gain a thorough understanding of metric production and ownership across all locations and work with the Measurement and Performance team to centralize and standardize the reporting to ensure global consistency and best practice management
  • Work closely with other business teams on the data collection, analysis and preparation of various ad hoc requests for management insights
  • Actively collaborate with IT development teams and operational teams to automate data collection processes and management
  • Develop and review management systems (EUC) in collaboration with stakeholders
  • Assist in formalizing operational procedures and documents tasks

What do you need to succeed?

Must-have

  • Undergraduate Business, Finance, or Statistics degree with 3+ years’ experience in financial services, preferably in Transfer Agency or Asset Management Services industry
  • Analytical thinking, problem solving skills, curiosity and critical thinking when analyzing big data
  • Advanced MS Excel (comprehensive formulas, pivot table, VBA Macro) and PowerPoint presentation skills
  • Data mining and reporting skill, with ability to explore new technologies to enhance the delivery of operating
  • Outstanding business and financial acumen with strong analytical, coordination, communication and presentation skills
  • As a guideline to ensure a reasonable time is spent in a role, you are expected to have at least 12 months of service in your current role for any lateral move.

Nice-to-have

  • Strong knowledge of banking products, processes (Fund Accounting, Custody, Shareholder Services, OTC …) and systems (Ruby, Webuploader, GRS, TLC …)
  • Project Management skill
  • May need to supervise/coordinate more junior resource activities and share experience
  • Experience with Client Experience and/or data automation would be considered an asset

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including performance based bonuses, flexible benefits, and competitive compensation
  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
  • A world-class training program in financial services
  • A collaborative dynamic culture where personal initiative and hard work are recognized and rewarded

Job Summary

What is the opportunity?
Investor & Treasury Services Malaysia is a processing center of operational excellence supporting 10 countries across three geographic time zones. The country employs a global operating model to maximize efficiencies across time zones and supports a 24/5 operations.

In this role, you will report to the Director, Measurement & Performance, Client Operations, and be responsible for monthly data collection and analysis for management and client KPI reporting deliverables. You will be working with all Client Operations business lines and support client managers on Client KPI related inquiries and requests. In addition, you will work with team members and data experts on initiatives to improve data management, automation and visualization.

Working hours: 1:00PM – 10:00PM (flexibility required due to time zone difference with Europe and Canada) 90% Business Days WFH
Region: Malaysia

Address:

Cyberjaya, Selangor, Malaysia

City:

MYS-SELANGOR-CYBERJAYA

Country:

Malaysia

Work hours/week:

40

Employment Type:

Full time

Platform:

Investor and Treasury Services

Job Type:

Regular

Pay Type:

Salaried

Posted Date:

2022-04-13-07:00

Application Deadline:

2022-09-08-07:00

item.title: Senior Technical Systems Analyst - Applications and Reporting
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Senior Technical Systems Analyst - Applications and Reporting

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

In this role you will be responsible for designing, developing and delivering sustainable, scalable end to end reporting solutions primarily to communicate service levels, operational and employee performance, productivity metrics/trends and portfolio quality measures.  These solutions are fulfilled in response to requests from operational partners for business reporting and insights and utilize a variety of data sources (enterprise and proprietary). You will serves as SME for reporting requests for the Credit Management and Recoveries Group, senior leaders and internal partners within RBC. You will also focus on quality, accuracy and consistency of reporting and insights requests, ensuring factual information is provided.

What will you do?

  • End-to-end design and development of reporting solutions to meet CMR partner needs, including formulating analytical framework, sourcing and preparing relevant data, performing data analyses, and presenting actionable insights
  • Develop and maintain automation capabilities/technologies and reporting infrastructure such as but is not limited to SQL Databases (or other data storage environments)
  • Accountable for providing reasonably accurate estimates of project scope and effort for each reporting request, creating work plans and adhering to target timelines
  • Recognize discrepancies during the development process between requirements and deliverables and communicate these discrepancies to partners
  • Create and maintain accurate, relevant technical documentation for each new or amended reporting solution, including technical solution specifications, data lineage and technical and business definitions for metrics, and test plan/test cases
  • Conduct testing and validation (including regression testing, when applicable) of new developed and enhancements applied to existing reporting solutions to ensure quality and adherence to business and technical requirements
  • Manage and escalate issues, risks and technology-related problems promptly as needed and appropriately actions
  • Effectively and openly communicate progress on assigned requests to key stakeholders

What do you need to succeed?

Must-have

  • Undergraduate Degree in quantitative discipline (i.e. Computer Science, Mathematics/Statistics), related field or equivalent related experience
  • Advanced programming/coding skills using various programming methods and languages
  • Experience in statistical methods, strong data profiling, cleaning, and mining, ability to perform complex data analysis on large volumes of data and present findings to senior leaders and inform strategic decisions
  • Demonstrated ETL and big data modeling capabilities, and programming experience with large databases/datasets using tools such as but not limited to;  SAS,Tableau,  WebFocus, Python, Hadoop (HIVE, Pig), Datameer, SQL Server, and Teradata SQL Assistant.
  • Advanced proficiency in developing reports using data visualization tools (most notably Tableau and SAS).

Nice-to-have

  • Experience in SAS and Tableau

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program
  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
  • Opportunities to do challenging work
  • Opportunities to take on progressively greater accountabilities
